1.text: Take your bacon out of the fridge 5-6 minutes before you start cooking.

2.text: Space out the bacon strips on a cool frying pan or griddle.

3.text: Heat the bacon over medium heat until it starts to sizzle.

4.text: Cook the bacon strips for 10-12 minutes.

5.text: Flip the bacon over and fry it for another 7-8 minutes until it's crisp.

6.text: Remove the bacon strips with tongs and drain them on a paper towel.

8.text: Line a rimmed baking sheet with aluminum foil.

9.text: Spread the bacon strips out flat on the baking sheet.

10.text: Cook the bacon in the preheated oven for 15-20 minutes.

11.text: Let the bacon drain on 2-3 layers of paper towels for several minutes.

12.text: Cover a microwave-safe plate with 3-4 layers of paper towels.

13.text: Lay the strips out on the plate and cover them with 1-2 paper towels.

14.text: Cook the bacon for 1 minute per strip on HIGH.

15.text: Keep cooking in 30-second intervals until it's as crispy as you want.

16.text: Transfer the bacon strips to a new plate to cool.

17.text: Marinate your bacon in maple syrup to make it "Vermont Style.

18.text: Cure your bacon in brown sugar before cooking it.

19.text: Add 1–2 tablespoons (15–30 ml) of water to your pan for crumbled bacon.
